sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Hello, you're watching Euronews Now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Let's take a look at the latest headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: South Africans mark the death of Archbishop Desmond Tutu with a week of events.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: The anti-apartheid leader will receive a state funeral on the 1st of January.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: France considers new restrictions after recording its highest rates of Covid infections since the start of the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: And with thousands of flights being cancelled worldwide, we take a look at the travel chaos during the festive period.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Across Cape Town, a homage to Archbishop Desmond Tutu, the South African anti-apartheid icon who has died aged 90.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Buildings were lit up in purple after his famous bright clerical gown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Tutu won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1984 and battled pancreatic cancer for 20 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Earlier South Africa's President, Simo Ramaphosa, paid his respects to the national hero.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He knew in his soul that good would triumph over evil, that justice would prevail over iniquity, and that reconciliation would prevail over revenge and recrimination. He knew that apartheid would one day end and that democracy would come.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Tutu coined the term Rainbow Nation to describe South Africa and in 1996 led a harrowing journey into the history of apartheid as the head of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Outside his long-term residence in Soweto, locals gathered to bid him farewell.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: As you know that this street is the only street where in the world the two Nobel Peace Prize winners have lived. You can then imagine us, the neighbours around, we are really touched by his passing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: He'll be missed a lot, played a very important role in the lives of blacks and just the lives of everyone in South Africa had a very huge impact.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: So he'll be dearly missed and may his soul rest in peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Desmond Tutu's impact changed not only South Africa but stretched far into the world, empowering pro-democracy activists and non-violent forms of resistance. His funeral has been set for the 1st of January.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Thousands of travellers have been left stranded with international flight cancellations due to

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: the sharp rise of Covid infections. The tourism sector is suffering huge losses due to staff shortages during the usually busy festive season. Well, for more on this disruption, I am now joined by Simon Calder in London. He is the senior travel editor of the Independent newspaper in the UK. Simon, thank you for joining us here at Euronews. Is all this because of COVID affecting staff shortages?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Is all this because of COVID affecting staff shortages?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: An awful lot of it is, but actually the problems, if you look worldwide, are a combination of a slump in demand, and that is particularly the case in Asia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: We've seen an awful lot of cancellations among Chinese airlines, also Lion Air of Indonesia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And that isn't because the Omicron variant is running riot through their flight crews. It's just because people are not prepared to travel so much over a holiday time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Are we likely to see more financial packages from global governments, given the recent losses incurred during this extremely busy, usually extremely busy, festive season?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: I think we are, Ru. Now, there's a couple of points here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: First of all, the European airlines were actually doing pretty well at repaying the loans they had received. For example, last month, Lufthansa of Germany handed back the whole of the 9 billion euro bailout that they had received. We've also seen, for example, in the U.S., federal funds supporting very heavily the airlines there. So I don't think they are in any danger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: China, where we've seen lots of cancellations, well, they are the three big airlines. They're a state-owned. And, of course, if you look at a Gulf-based carrier like Qatar Airways, then you will most definitely they don't need to make a profit because they are state-supported. However, it is that maybe the European low-cost airlines, Ryanair, EasyJet, Wizz Air, which are battling through, but they haven't had any real financial support. Smaller European airlines, I think, will need some. And then, looking more widely, African and Latin American airlines, particularly from those in tourism-dependent countries, will definitely need more support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Belgium, thousands of people have been protesting against the government's decision

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: to shut down the country's cultural activities to stem rising cases of COVID-19.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: From actors and performers to event organisers, the cry for cultural venues to remain open was the same.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Many believe the industry is doing enough to keep people safe in the most difficult of circumstances.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It gives me joy, culture, it gives me hope.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And now in these times, these desperate times, even that is taken away.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So I'm really sad and upset that this still is happening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: That's why I'm here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Culture is very important. It always helps.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's an economic activity, but we need it also for our mental health.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It is the only way for people to live experiences, to tell stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It is of paramount importance for us to be open in these complicated and complex times.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: In Brussels, several cinemas and theatres say they will risk fines but will not follow the rules.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: The new restrictions come despite a steady decline in the number of hospital admissions for Covid-19 in Belgium over recent weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: But the government says the extremely virulent nature of the Omicron variant has forced it to take preventative measures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: According to organisers, up to 15,000 people took part in the demonstration and further protests are planned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: London was quiet as Covid fears hit the traditional Boxing Day sales.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: However, lured by free tea, as only the British could be, some were determined to come out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: You don't have to, you know, stop living.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So just live your life and it's new normal now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: I've been triple vaccinated and as you can see, there's probably enough social distance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: In the British city of York, things were also calm amid a nationwide drop in footfall of 45% on 2019.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Some businesses felt the pinch.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: It was a really slow start today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: It was almost like, are we ever going to get anyone in?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: I mean, the fact that we had got some confirmed bookings coming in and some families that we know that regularly come here on Boxing Day, so we were quite fortunate with that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: But other than that, it has been really quiet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Tighter restrictions came into force in Northern Ireland, Wales and Scotland on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: For many businesses, it was another disappointing Boxing Day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Boxing Day. Some Canadians faced a severe cold snap with the coldest temperature on Sunday being minus 50 degrees Celsius in the Northwest Territories. An extreme

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: cold weather warning was in effect from many places including the city of Saskatoon. The warning was issued due to risks to health such as frostbite and hypothermia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: The Turkish Border Patrol was busy this Christmas Eve managing traffic flow from its neighbouring

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: countries. Hundreds of Christmas shoppers from Greece and Bulgaria flock to the bordering Turkish town of Erdene looking to benefit from the declining Turkish lira.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The first stop for shoppers is the currency exchange office, then it's off to the markets and grocery stores.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I came from Greece this morning. I exchanged 100 euro here and bought gifts for myself and the family. I am very happy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: It's more convenient for me to shop here. I'll buy clothes and food and whatever we need for the children and grandchildren for Christmas. Bulgaria is much more expensive than here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: You asked how much lev I have exchanged.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: I exchanged 500 lev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: It's enough for all of us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: The Turkish lira has experienced its most volatile month in December, declining to an all-time low of 18.36 against the US dollar on December 20th. This prompted Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan to announce new financial tools to protect lira deposits against currency fluctuations. As the year comes to a close, our website has been taking a look at some of the cultural figures we lost in 2021.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: You can check out that and get more on the latest stories dominating the headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Tributes are continuing to pour in for the man South Africans affectionately called the Arch.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Well, one man who knew him well and wrote extensively about his life is Reverend Michael Battle, and he joins me now from New York. Thank you for joining us, Reverend. Archbishop Tutu had an infectious laugh and he was never afraid to speak his mind. Can you tell us about your relationship with him? DR. When I was doing my academic Ph.D., doctoral degree, I had an opportunity to go and meet him and ask him if he would permit me to write my dissertation on his theology.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And the first thing he said was, let us pray. And at that moment, I realized this was not just academic work. And subsequent events occurred, and I was also allowed to actually live with him in Cape Town when he was at the end of his years of being the Archbishop of the province of Southern Africa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: So as you can imagine, this was a wonderful opportunity for me.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: He leaves a huge void for South Africans and he was a voice of hope for so many.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: How do you think he'll be remembered?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: I think in several ways.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: be remembered? DR.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: DAVID BATES, I think in several ways.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: I think, first, he has articulated a theology and a political well-being in terms of what it means to be a human being. is Ubuntu, which is a proverb, which means, I am because you are, and because you are, I am.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: So it's a wonderful way of practicing humanity based on interdependence, not a weak codependence, not a negative way of putting others down, but a way of being in congruence in which each of our interests are aligned and do not conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

The Environment Ministry said that firefighting efforts have been complicated by difficult terrain, large distances between blazes, wind, high temperatures and dry vegetation in the midst of a drought.
